name: Goya's painting in a book's edge.
description:
This photograph captures a small reproduction of "El 3 de Mayo en Madrid" (May 3 in Madrid) by Francisco de Goya in a book of selected novels by Benito Pérez Galdós published by Aguilar in 1954. The objective of this type of photograph is to obtain a record visual of unique pieces involved in the construction of a book. As Roger Chartier says: a writer doesn't make books, he just writes them. 
We keep an eye on this process by collecting, not only "analog"-printed books, but also taking them as a source for art experimentation.
The picture is an 2048x4608 JPG, captured with a humble Nikon D3100, 18-55 lens in Van Hutten Libros, 6th may of 2021 in Córdoba - Argentina.

Also the book can be buyed in our ig@vanhuttenlibros
